intro: Isocoma bracteosa, commonly known as the desert sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as hairy leaves to reduce water loss. Its yellow-orange ray flowers are showy and attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Isocoma bracteosa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in sandy or gravelly habitats.
